turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about Navaratri.
turn.1: what is the difference between new born baby and a grown up
turn.2: The elder writes a letter and the child writes the same with his or her index finger.
turn.4: This Hindu tradition is so popular that Christian organizations have copied it and ritually observe it inside many churches.
turn.5: is it only observed in kerala
turn.6: However, Navratri traditions of Hindus is not the only tradition observed by Kerala Christians, many other Hindu ritual traditions are celebrated in Churches.
turn.7: how is it different in other parts of india
turn.8: The Navaratri celebrations vary across Maharashtra and the specific rites differ between regions even if they are called the same and dedicated to the same deity.
turn.9: what is the most common way of celebrating it
turn.10: The most common celebration begins on the first day of Navaratri with Ghatasthapana ("sthapana" of a "ghat"), which literally means "mounting of a jar".
turn.12: On this day, rural households mount a copper or brass jar, filled with water, upon a small heap of rice kept on a wooden stool ("pat").
